intro: Lindernia venustula, commonly known as the pretty lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom from summer to fall. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Lindernia venustula is also known for its ability to attract butterflies and hummingbirds with its nectar-rich blooms.
